description:
Even though this is a new place in the hood, they adapted so fast and raised their hand sayin "We r gonna be givin u guyz good food and smiles for a long time!"
 As i notice they r using really fine ingredients and they have so affordable prices according to what u get! 
I tried many dishes so far but the weekend brunches are my favorite! 
The turkish breakfast plater is the best option for couples, it comes with 4 eggs and traditional turkish beef sausage. It is great for 2 people to share.

Our server Yasemin was very attentive and sincere, whatever we need, she brought before even we ask! She was smiling all the time as everybody in the place.

This place is the sweetest neighborhood spot...
author: Mert M.

description:
I loved Lokma and this was my first Turkish breakfast before going to Turkey. Plus, they were so nice to my girlfriend, who is from Istanbul. 

Definitely go out of your comfort zone and try things you can barely pronounce. You will be pleasantly surprised that sucuk tastes amazing, the portions are huge, and menemen is the best thing ever.

Who knows, you too might end up sitting alongside the Bosporus, next to Topkapı Palace, sipping Turkish Coffee before you know it. It could all be because you had breakfast at Lokma. You never know!

afiyet olsun !
author: Ryan G.

description:
Got the turkish breakfast which is meant for two people to share. The turkish breakfast includes 4 eggs, "sausage", pita bread, kaymak, hummus, jam, olives, cucumber, tomato, cheese, walnuts, and some fruit. Would definitely come back for this as I've been craving kaymak (clotted cream and honey) and I was quite satisfied. 

I also got the greek yogurt pancakes which were great to try. I didn't love them but my brunch buddies enjoyed them.
author: Sophia L.

description:
I wouldn't call myself a pancake fiend, but I find myself becoming more critical of the pancakes I tasted over the years. I myself make pancakes at home and I have experienced uttered failure as well as amazing success. So when i had the Greek yogurt pancakes at Lokma, I knew i was in for a treat. It was not just the fluffiness or the crispy edges, the gentle sweetness of the fragrant blueberry compost, or the rich creaminess with mild tanginess of the Greek yogurt, but also the crackling sound of the granola in your mouth that make the whole thing tastes like a good Sunday morning. 

My friend had the Sunrise combo which includes small version of the pancakes, scrambled eggs and sujuk, a spiced sausage that is very mealy and deliciously tangy.

Their AndyTown coffee was average I would say. And its temperature was a bit low for my liking. After adding the half and half it was just lukewarm. 

Their interior is modern and airy, but just a bit dark for my taste. 

The server we had was nice and attentive.

I feel that Lokma is worth a return, as I would like to try their Turkish breakfast set for 2 which looks amazing.
author: Thuy V.

description:
When you think of brunch in SF, you think of long waits and exorbitant prices. Well I don't know how true that is but I'm assuming it's true. Lokma however, is neither of the above. It's low key and affordable but even better, it's really good. Lokma mixes brunch and Turkish together for a perfect brunch experience.

The sunrise combo and Turlu omelette were both really good and may be the more popular items on the menu. Fluffy pancakes topped with greek yogurt and berries makes for a unique but delicious experience. The Turkish sausage is a nice alternative to the many other not as good breakfast sausages out there. It's a nice surprise mixing Turkish/Mediterranean flavors and brunch foods together; they complement each other quite nicely.

Lokma may become highly popular soon so come by before then. It's still low key so far and while I wish the best success for them, I also enjoy not waiting for brunch so... yeah, I dunno. Eat here.
author: Derek T.

description:
I walked by Lokma one evening, took a note to return, and am glad I did.

This is my favorite brunch in the Richmond, hands down. Turkish food reminds me of my parent's cooking and it's as close of a breakfast as one I had growing up.

Do get the Turkish breakfast for two, try some Turkish coffee (or tea), and add a pancake. Even though it's always way too much food- it's definitely the move.

Service is great too!
author: Arezou A.

description: Amazing food!! I had never tried Scandinavian eggs before but I'm addicted now. The staff was super friendly, the ambiance great, and the food amazing!
author: Ina S.

description:
I love this place! The food tasted great! My kids loved it. 

It's Turkish/ European style.
author: Shady S.

description:
Lokma does an excellent job of serving classic brunch items such as omelets, breakfast sandwiches and pancakes but with a Turkish twist.

Everything on their menu is traditional breakfast dishes but with a little something extra. It's hard to explain the food, but it's extremely good and I would highly recommend you check this place out if you're in the area!
author: James D.

description:
Wow. Just incredible. 

I'm always delighted to find a place that serves high-quality brunch without a stupid long wait. Lokma fits the bill. 

This is a Turkish/Mediterranean restaurant situated in your hipster interior designer friend's home -- gorgeous brick, plants, lots of natural sunlight. Oh, and the food is amazing.

I ordered the Sunrise combo, which comes with pancakes, scrambled eggs and Turkish sausage. The pancakes are the best I've ever had - fluffy and topped with greek yogurt and berries. The eggs were fine, but the pancakes stood out the most. My husband had the burger that is made with beef and lamb and said it was fantastic (he only let me have one bite).

We would come back in a heartbeat. (Please don't get too popular.)
author: Valerie L.

description: Had higher expectations for the flavors since I saw a 5x review. We ate the Baba Ganoush, and two entrees; Presídio Salad and the Manti, the most recommended. The salad dressing had zero flavor with a pink hue, so we were happy they served it on the side. The salad tasted good overall because of the fresh ingredients but lacked any distinct flavor due to the lack of dressing. The Manti I had super high hopes for, but once again underwhelming. The light yogurt sauce was plain and as a garsnish the tomato "sauce" over the dish tasted like tomato paste right out of a can.
author: Eduardo S.

description: Best mediterranean place in the area! Great for breakfast and dinner. Super friendly staff
author: Matt M.

description: Ate outside so that our pup could join us. Absolutely loved the greek yogurt pancakes - so moist! Also enjoyed the coffee and an omelet. Would definitely recommend.
author: Brooke C.

description:
Date & Time:  Sunday February 11, 2018 @ 1pm
Brunch Date:  The Husband
Scene:  Couples & Groups in Sweaters, Tights & Boots
Music:  Carly Simon & James Taylor
Decor:  Urban Rustic.  Faux Exposed Brick Walls & Reclaimed Woods Makes for a Hip Neighborhood Spot
Service:  Attractive, Efficient Staff
Imbibe:  Turkish Coffee
Devour:  Turkish Scrambler & Greek Yogurt Pancakes
Total:  $28.28
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
This place is casual, low-key and amazing! 

Lots of open seating and natural light. We got the Turkish breakfast and Greek yogurt pancakes. So delectable and so many good flavors! Coffee had free re-fills. 

'Total food porn' - my BF

We loved it!
author: Bree G.

description:
Lokma: Lokma is a really nice place but the manti were all covered in mayonnaise. My daughter ordered chicken grill she loved it. It had arugula,
Rice, chicken grill, tomatoes, and zukini. It was delicious but he the manti tasted dry and disgusting. If you ever go to Lokma never get manti.
author: Igor R.

description: Literally worst choice I've made in a while to come here. We were walking around and saw this place had a few tables and nice setup so we decided to try. The two females waiters were more busy talking to each other than taking care of customers. When our food finally showed it was mediocre at best. All in all it's pretty obvious the owner of the restaurant is not very experienced because the quality of service is not ok. Will not come back
author: Helen C.

description:
Lokma is the most lovely little spot in an unassuming corner of the Richmond with the most gorgeous brunch food I have ever had in the city. Albeit, I have only eaten here once, but I am in love lol. 

My bf and I came to Lokma without many prior expectations other than we needed food that would satiate us and our expectations were waaay exceeded. We helped ourselves to the sunrise combo, turlu omelet (w/ avocado), hummus and pita, and the fresh orange juice. Everything was sooo incredibly flavorful and honestly what I believe brunch food in heaven tastes like. 

Everything we had we would have again, but our absolute favorite and what we would recommend are their pancakes!!! We've never had pancakes that tasted the way these do... They're huge, thick, plush (so filling), and have an unexpected spiced flavor that pairs perfectly with the tangy yogurt and sweet berries served on top. I used to say I liked waffles more than pancakes until the day I had the pancakes at Lokma. I daydream about their pancakes....

Lokma is 100000% my favorite brunch spot in the city so far, and my bf and I are beyond excited to revisit Lokma tomorrow and explore more of their menu and revisit our fav pancakes in the city. Here's to hoping for the same amazing experience our second time around lol!
author: Anna L.

description:
Great food, great service, what a gem!

I came here for brunch and I must say, there were really solid flavors that tied in the Turkish cuisine. I enjoyed the Turkish breakfast ($28) which includes a cold plate of hummus, honey butter, olives, cured meats, and veggies. As well as the hot plate, four eggs and sujuk sausage. It was served with Pita bread and allowed me to pick and choose which flavor adventure I wanted to dive into. It was my first time having sujuk sausage which was fantastic. It is more crunchy than most sausages and really packed with salty flavor. I also tried a bite of the lamb burger! It was good, but too gamey for my personal preference.
author: Tina O.

description: Made a Yelp just so I can leave this review. This place is over priced and not worth it at all. The portions were small and not filling at all. I thought since it's a neighbor hood restaurant it would be authentic and at least filling but I was wrong. Wish I listened to my friends and tried something else instead.
author: Mike H.

description:
Great food and service. For lunch 
/dinner, Highly recommend the lamb meatballs and sea bass. For breakfast, we recommend the pancakes! The owner is lovely.
author: Leena E.

description: Possibly my favorite brunch in the City. The Turkish Breakfast is incredible. They give you Sujuk with fried eggs and Bastirma. The Kaymak is one of the best I've had and I'm from Azerbaijan originally. Possibly the best Turkish place around. I never tire of it. Oh and tea and the service is just simply incredible!
author: Daniel K.

description: I like the food taste plus the presentation wise at Lokma. The Turkish coffee cups are small with perfect taste though. The staff are friendly and helpful. I would visit this place again!
author: Reema M.

description: This place was terrible. The servers was not very attentive. Overall food was pretty bland and over priced. Would not recommend this place at all
author: Jack W.

description: Dined here twice, once for breakfast and came back for dinner. Deeeeeelicious food and great service! Need to come back for lunch!
author: Bessie L.

description: Had the Turkish breakfast and it was tasty. It came with pita bread, hummus, olives, halved grape tomatoes, chopped walnuts, cured Turkish meat, Turkish sausage, orange slices and 2 raspberries, 4 eggs over easy, and the clotted cream with honey. My favorite part of brunch was the clotted cream & honey.
author: P C.

description:
Came here recently for an early lunch and the food, ambiance and service were awesome!
Started with the clotted cream with honey and pita (so good there was no time for a picture, just shoveling of food in face) and ended with the vegetarian goulash omelet. The potatoes were crispy and on point, served with some fruit and the omelet was huge and topped with a yogurt sauce with dill. Will definitely be coming back to try those pancakes- I was eyeballing them at another guest's table lol  
Overall, great experience and would highly recommend to others.
author: Ariel F.

description: Great service.  Andytown coffee and turkish coffee.  Price reasonable for 14.00 breakfast entree.   We had the sunrise with fluffy greek yogurt pancake, loved the tartness of sauce, scramble eggs and pieces of sausages.  Had the Mediterranean dish with veggie pita with babaghoulish (eggplant) and Olives. Nice little place.
author: Helen L.

description:
the walk of shame to the brunch of shame. classic.

jk this is a nice clean wholesome place. none of the other tables looked "guilty".

turkish menu.

CHICKEN SANDWICH w yogurt. GREEK YOGURT PANCAKES w sujuk (dank turkish sausage). ICED TEA. TURKISH COFFEE.

nothing super adventurous or zingy but it felt clean & light eating it all. like i don't have to kill my arteries or hate myself later. ty
author: Dan B.

description: Love this place! I got the breakfast sandwich and YUM, so good. The ambiance and service here are just perfect. I cannot wait to come back and bring all of my loved ones
author: Desiree A.

description:
Lokma for me was a great new find in the Richmond district. I had brunch here on 4/1/18 with the kiddo and wifey and it was pleasant. The place was really clean and homey and the staff were attentive and friendly.

I had ordered a Turlu Omelette and Sunrise Combo. Both were really clean and healthy tasting. If I wasn't recovering from stomach issues I'd have gone much bolder with the lamb/beef burger... always a next time!

I really enjoyed my time there today and it didn't hurt my wallet! Another plus was my daughter was able to sit through in their clean high chair and enjoy her meal as well!
author: Benny S.

description: Lokma is a lovely brunch place! It's not too crowded which is my favorite part. The coffee is good with free refills. It's $3.75. The pancakes are really good with a great zingy tart yogurt base. The honey is a wonderful addition. No need for maple syrup like regular pancakes. Everything you need is on the plate. It was $13 for 3 pancakes which is pretty good for SF. My friend got the breakfast sandwich. She said the potatoes were fire and the sandwich was good too. The service was nice as well. I will definitely be going back to Lokma.
author: Caitlyn S.

description:
Pancakes are sooooo great!!!!!
Others are good but a little salty. 
The service is actually great and not people coming here so there's no need to wait.
author: Ye Z.

description:
Came here for dinner a month ago. We wanted Turkish food so we decided to try this new restaurant.

We usually start our meals with wine but the waitress told us that they do not have their liquor license so they did not have wine. We asked if we could go to the corner liquor store to buy wine & pay a corkage fee, and they said no. We considered going across the street to Tia Margarita for cocktails then returning for dinner but remembered that the Warriors were playing in the finals so that bar would be packed. 

The hummus was good but the pita was hard & seemed to be old or at least made some time ago. We then ordered another basket of pita and that was softer & fresher.

Our entrees were decent even though the chicken was a bit overcooked and dry.

It is a cute restaurant and I like to patronize small neighborhood restaurants but I cannot totally recommend this place for dinner. Perhaps brunch is better, judging from the other Yelp reviews.
author: Chilly W.

description:
Was very impressed with their menu. Although I'm basing this off two items I tried. 

I highly recommend their turlu dish. It was a nice meatless option. I'm not vegetarian. Portion size was nice and not too little or too heavy. 

Their pancakes were amazing. I do not like pancakes in general and I would order it here. 

This will be a new lunch spot for me. Keep it up Lokma team.
author: Lyman C.

description: A hidden gem in the hearth of Richmond District. Cozy little corner restaurant with a nice vibe and awesome food. I try to come to Lokma to taste their delicious Turkish Breakfast whenever I get a chance. Even during the weekends there is no line, which is a luxury in SF. My favorite is Sunset Combo, which is a mixture of turkish and american breakfast, a perfect way to start my day.
author: Berk G.

description:
Amazing place, very cozy design, nice atmosphere,good music. Food is delicious! Waiter girl was super sweet. 


Very glad i came here. The best Turkish food in SF!
author: Lana S.

description: A really excellent breakfast for two with a great atmosphere. The Kaymak and honey was delicious.
author: E M.

description:
Very cute and cozy new spot! Food is good, so is pricing but limited menu options. Pancakes are amazing BUT I had to come back & take 1 star away since they changed the ingredients used in original whipped cream+yogurt on top of pancakes - it WAS amazing and sweet. The only reason I said they were amazing.

Now it's just plain sour cream or yogurt, tasteless. Please keep it as it was when you opened up.
author: Natalie G.

description: Very cool brunch spot. The ambiance is casual, a lot of seating options and friendly staff. Best Turkish breakfast in San Francisco so far. Love love love it!
author: Dilan Ş.

description:
I took my parents here when we all had a day off from work and they LOVED it. Such a sweet staff and the food is amazing!! We had the turkish breakfast and greek yogurt pancakes. Perfect sized servings and cute presentation. Family style also. 
The staff was very hospitable, and it was so cute how they freaked out over forgetting to bring out a side dish that we ordered. We didn't end up needing it because we were so full, but they were so worries about it and it showed they cared.

5 STARS!!!
author: Abby O.

description: We are so happy this gem of a place opened up in our neighborhood. The food is fantastic, the ambiance is lovely and the owner is so wonderful (she's a young woman from Istanbul who just graduated from Berkeley and decided to stay in SF to pursue her dream in sharing her passion for food and culture). We tried the dinner and can't wait to come back and try her breakfast/brunch menu. We're happy to support this small woman-led business!
author: A. E.

description: I live on the same street, I notice this place and wanted to have breakfast with my daughter, sometime healthy. Lokma didn't disappoint, the pancakes were delicious & so light and fluffy , the potato's were amazing, and the Turkish Sausage is very good & different nice and lean too. The scrambled eggs were fluffy and delicious. I can't wait to go back for Dinner next time!i highly recommend the Sunrise Combo!!!
author: Rosemarie D.

description: This is best Turkish food I ever have. I really enjoyed this brunch with my husband and my 7 months old baby. This place is totally family friendly. I don't agree with any bad reviews for this place, I totally respect the culture and food. No matter where we go, we always try and enjoy it. Love the restaurant environment and and setting. I 100% recommending this place to all the people we know. We are so lucky to have this restaurant in our neighborhood. Thank you for serving us authentic Turkish Meal.
author: Unyo N.

description: Best Turkish breakfast I have ever had in San Francisco. Staff is really kind and ambiance is very cozy. Keep up the good work Lokma!
author: Umut K.

description: What a delightful Anatolian breakfast. Lots of varieties and everything is so flavorful. The breakfast platter is a must try because it offers a world of everything. I recommend to everyone wanting to experience an authentic meal. Super friendly staff that stays on top of the work and takes care of the table from start to finish.
author: Baran Y.

description:
I never leave yelp reviews, but this place was so amazing that I just had to share how delicious their breakfast is! We had the egg sandwich and the pancakes. Both were so so delicious that my boyfriend and I barely spoke to each other bc we were busy eating! It's a little pricey but worth it.

This place is new and precious restaurants haven't made it. Everyone we have to keep this place in business!

We can't wait to try their dinner!
author: Katherine W.

description: Awesome Greek yogurt pancakes! I've never had pancakes prepared in this manner before and these were a delicious surprise. The Bulgur porridge was very good too. This place is reasonably priced and the service was friendly. I will definitely be back.
author: Brian C.

description: It was our first visited at Lokma. It was a cool spot that explore right close to your neighborhood.i would suggest you to taste Turkish ( Anatolian ) breakfast and Menemen!! You can literally smell fresh ingredients from a mile ! So yummy!!
author: Cagdas B.

description:
Every single time I come here I'm not disappointed. The food is AMAZING! I've gone for dinner on multiple occasions and let me tell you I'm always so happy when I leave. The atmosphere is quiet and relaxing and perfect for a low-key dinner out. The owners are humble and are always open to ensuring you have an enjoyable experience. The option of Mediterranean inspired food in this neighborhood was much needed to add some variety to the restaurants in the area. 

Make sure you get the dumplings!!
author: Tia H.

description:
Been here twice, the Manti is one of the best dishes in the neighborhood. It's pork dumplings in yogurt and tomato sauce with basil. Simple, fresh, delicious. Just order it. You're welcome.

The pita with cream and honey is delightful. 

The couscous dish was mediocre though. 

Still give them 5 stars cuz the Manti will have me coming back for years. 

Decor is nice, service great blah blah. Honestly all that matters to me in a restaurant review is the food.
author: Nathan N.

description: We live a few blocks from Lokma and we come most weekends for brunch. Their yogurt pancakes are crazy delicious. They have a number of vegetarian options which is good for me, my hubby eats everything and has tried a number of their dishes and has loved them all. I also love that they have outdoor seating so we can bring our dog.
author: Lauren M.

description:
I really wanted to like this new local spot! Restaurant was clean and quiet 

We ordered the octopus, papas bravas, and Turkish dumplings. The two apps were tasty, but the octopus portion was very small for the cost. Only 5 bite size pieces. The entree was ok - plenty of dumplings but fairly one note. Would have loved veggies or other garnishes to make it more interesting. And for $20, I was hoping for more 

Service was great. I may come back for brunch, but probably not for dinner
author: Christina S.

description:
What an absolute gem! I was so pleased to discover this place and will absolutely come back (probably more often than is good for my wallet)!

The food is excellent, a perfect balance of tasty and healthy. The service is fast and friendly (my mom accidentally ordered what she thought was fruit juice and it turned out to be soda; they swapped it for juice at no extra charge). We arrived around 10:00 a.m. on a Sunday with a party of four and didn't have to wait for a table. The prices are a steal--cheaper than other restaurants and totally worth the quality and quantity of food you get.

I can't wait to come back and try the dinner menu!
author: Lindsey S.

description:
Came here twice now and the service never disappointes me!

The first time we came here during dinner the food was excellent!
The second time we came for brunch was okay. (maybe it was too healthy for me) Ordered the omelet with potatoes. The potatoes were bland and dry. 

Service:
5 star! The female servers are all very friendly and patient with ordering. 

In my opinion, the food won't taste as good if the service isn't on point! *This is for all restaurants*
author: Potatoe Q.

description: a great environment for catching up with friends. staff is really friendly. food is so good!!
author: Soojeong H.

description:
Here we go,
I tried it today.Super brand new restaurant.It's in pretty quiet, peaceful neighborhood.The atmosphere and design are perfectly balanced in between clutter and too simple.You can fully enjoy daylight even you sit inside.
MUSIC.It was pretty awesome.Not too loud not bad choice either.it was Perfectly background music.This is compared to many other Turkish restaurants in the city or even bay area.I truly loved it.

FOOD.It was a decent.No lie.But let's keep remember this is only a week old restaurant.I am sure they will get way better soon in the future.Although the service covers all.My server"s name was Neslihan who was a really charming young lady.Whatever and whenever you needed, she was right next to you.

So overall, give it a try.For 2 good reasons.First, support a brandnew and excited neighborhood restaurant and the second discover another hidden treasure in the city.
author: Metalmonarch Y.

description: Honestly I hardly ever review, but this meal was amazing. The calamari was seasoned to perfection, the steak was tender and the lamb balls were tasty AF. I could eat the feta mashed potatoes all day! I will be bringing everyone here.
author: Soledad M.

description: I really liked this place. I had the Greek yogurt pancakes, eggs, and Turkish sausage. Tasted simple and well made but delicious. Let me tell you .. I'm not a big pancake person and I inhaled the whole thing. Their portion was just right and it wasn't too heavy unlike how I usually feel when I eat brunch.  Oh and the service was impeccable. The waiter was super nice.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Best breakfast place in Richmon, SF. Tried Turkish Breakfast Plate with Menemen. Be back next week.
author: Ceyhun D.

description:
This is an absolute gem of a restaurant and maybe the best Turkish food in the City. We've eaten here multiple times for dinner--once with a group of seven--trying their manti (delicious little Turkish raviolis), a Turkish take on ratatouille with orzo (whose name I forget), the Presidio salad (get it with the phenomenal grilled chicken), their addictive papas bravas, and their grilled branzino (which is practically enough for two). We've also had both deserts and there wasn't a disappointing dish among any of the ones we've tried. 
I just got the message that their wine and beer license has come in, the lack of which was the only thing that prevented this restaurant from being perfect. Maybe now it is!
author: John P.

description: We just had a great brunch at this beautifully designed restaurant. We had Turkish breakfast plate, menemen and Greek yogurt pancakes. Tasty and great presentation. It's a nice bright corner space with great service. We will be back to try them for dinner soon.
author: Mutlu T.

description: Everything was fantastic! Almost got everything on the menu lol. The service was wonderful. I most definitely will be coming back !
author: Cee-Cee K.

description:
I haven't tried the brunch, but my wife and I stopped by for dinner after noticing that a new restaurant was open. I was impressed by the food and the service here. We started with the warm olives and papas bravas, and for entrees went with the Turkish dumplings and the short rib stew. All of them were delicious. If we could have stolen a bottle of the tomato sauce from the dumplings we probably would have. I ordered the tea, and our server was great about keeping both that and our water refilled.

We'll definitely be back soon!
author: Doug T.

description:
Great spot! Only been open 5 days but loving what I'm seeing so far during their soft launch. 

Waiter recommended the Turkish breakfast, and it was great! So many options on the plate it's a choose your own adventure every bite!

Great new spot to have in the neighborhood for breakfast/lunch. Will definitely come back to try the breakfast sandwich and pancakes.
author: Nick S.

description: This is a wonderful little neighborhood breakfast spot. Friendly staff, fresh food. Great decor, with a light and airy space. I had the sunrise combo, and I thought the sausage was delicious. I would recommend the Turkish coffee!
author: Jay C.

description: Beautiful ambiance, great coffee & tea and wonderful service! Glad to have stumbled in for brunch during the soft launch. I split the Turkish breakfast, and while it was a fun mix of foods, the portions we're a bit small for the price tag. It wasn't enough food for a full meal - would have been better if paired with another dish or more pita/hummus. Also, a small thing but for a dish meant to be split, it would have been  nice to have an even number of pita to split :) We didn't try the pancakes, but they looked amazing!! Looking forward to coming back for dinner - I hope they do take out ;)
author: Claire S.

description: Such a great addition to the neighborhood! We've eaten here for both brunch and dinner now and would definitely recommend.
author: Molly W.

description: I love Lokma! A cute and homey Turkish inspired brunch spot in the Inner Richmond district of San Francisco. We had the chicken sandwich, the menemen, and the avocado toast. First of all, the avocado toast is impeccable. You get three different kinds for toast on one platter, my favorite was the feta cheese avocado toast. Second of all, the staff there is so kind and welcoming. You can tell that they really care about their business  and their customers. If you're looking for a relaxed Sunday brunch, this is the place to go!
author: Minaaz S.

description: Awesome food. The Manti (dumplings) stole the show with their amazing garlic yogurt sauce. The carrot hummus was a delicious appetizer. We also had orange tahini cake to finish things off. I hope they'll be around for a long time to come.
author: Matthew W.

description: Best turkish brunch place in SF. Food is fresh and delicious. Menemen is a must! Staff is very friendly and quick.
author: Ebru Ö.

description: Lokma is a great breakfast place on clement street which newly open. Turkish breakfast plate is absolutely amazing . Service is attentive and customers are very well cared. I will definitely come back and try other items on the menu.
author: Korzay N.

description:
Boy - that was a delicious breakfast!!

Great food and fantastic service!

THANK YOU!!
author: Stuart N.

description: Came here for brunch with my mom, the Turkish breakfast was amazing! Can't wait to return for dinner :)
author: Fleur R.

description: There was a weird smell inside so I preferred to sit outside. Menemen was awful. The was not fresh and turkish style. I think they use canned tomate which makes the taste like tomate paste.
author: Onur E.

description:
Lokma is delicious! We ordered the Turkish breakfast and the Turlu omelette to split and it was like a feast on our table. Beautiful and so so good.
The wait staff is excellent, too. 
We'll be back!
author: Karen S.

description: Awesome spot!! Delicious and authentic food with quality ingredients. The Turkish plate for 2 is a winner... as are the delish pancakes and fresh salads. Very thoughtful service and serene atmosphere! The place looks brand new and us refreshingly elegant for the neighborhood without being fussy or annoying! Try the Turkish coffee...
author: Aida C.

description: Not worth the trip. Hardly authentic for those that are familiar with Turkish food. Lacks focus and effort.
author: Cdub S.

description:
We were happy to see this place open on Clement west of Park Presidio.  We stopped in for supper tonight and are happy to report our experience:  tasty food, prompt and friendly service in a welcoming environment.  We will definitely be going back.  

I truly hope they can make it in this space that has been a revolving door for restaurants over the years.
author: Maureen P.

description: Great brunch spot for the Richmond district.  The location seemed to have been cursed, but it looks like Lokma is here so stay. We ordered the Turkish breakfast and pancakes for 2.5 people and it was more than enough.  The flavors are so authentic and I loved their bread was freshly baked.  Congratulations on getting off to a great start and good luck to you.
author: Samantha S.

description: You gotta try the Presidio Salad!! Really enjoyed my first visit and will definitely be back
author: Eli F.

description: Great Turkish breakfast with fresh ingredients (and generous portions). Highly recommended
author: Onur E.

description: Great new restaurant that serves both brunch and now dinner. Brunch was good, but the evening fare was even better. We had the Manti (turkish meat dumplings), short rib stew and the grilled chicken all very good but the stew was particularly good. Nice ambiance, pleasant staff and tables are available without the dire hour waits and confusion that have become a staple of some of the restaurants in the neighborhood.
author: Jason O.

description: My first time here and i already loved it !! 'Mantı' is for real real my friends !!!  my recommendation will be so high ,,
author: Cem B.

description:
Summary: Yummy! Eat here!

Review: My friend visiting from out of town wanted to try this spot because of the Turkish breakfast. It looked amazing!!! We didn't get it but the people next to us did and they were pretty stoked on it! Anyway, my friend and I both got different egg dishes and we were both super happy. Her's came with some kind of ratatouille and that was extra yummy. My friend who is quite a foodie, said it was the best omelette she has ever had. I felt like an A+ host and I believe she will visit my again. Yay! A delicious high light was the clotted cream and honey served with pita. There was also traditional Turkish coffee. The grounds in the bottom of the cup made me feel worldly and sophisticated. The server was super friendly but not over bearing or pushy. My friend was happy, my baby was happy and it was just a really great experience all around.  We visited on a weekday so no wait at all. Closed on mondays.
author: Brandy C.

description:
I was so surprised at the quality of food and level of service at Lokma.  

Their small plates are actually really large! 
- Lamb Meatballs - We got 5 meatballs!  They were moist and the flavorful.  The yogurt along with it was delicious.
- Mussels - Again, delicious mussels cooked to perfections.
- Papas Bravas - Not too oily and herbs complimented it well!  Would get again!

Large Plates were really large!  
- Turkish Ratatouille - Probably my least favorite dish but that really says something about all the other dishes because this was really good. 
- Dumplings - This was my favorite.  The dumpling skin was really soft while the filling was a nice surprise.  Even though there wasn't a lot of filling, the meat still held its own.

I'll be coming back soon!
author: Christopher L.

description: I would really like to give this place a higher review, but the service was SLOOOOOOOW, the food was slightly better than average, the portions were small, and some of the wait staff doesn't fully understand english which makes ordering or asking for things slightly complicated.  The wait staff was nice, and although they did take off the price of our drinks (two coffees and a lemonade), it wasn't enough to make me feel better about our experience.  Either this place needs more cooks in the kitchen, or a more efficient wait staff.  I'm not sure why we had to wait an hour for two egg dishes and a chicken sandwich?  Maybe since it's new they are still finding their feet, but I'm hoping they find it soon!
author: Brent W.

description: I've eaten brunch, lunch and evening snacks here and everything has been delicious.  The eggplant omelet is quite tasty and the accompanying potatoes were perfectly crisp on the outside while creamy on the inside.   The lamb/beef burger was juicy and flavorful with a cabbage salad and a tangy avocado/ lemon dressing.  For snacks, we had meatballs and skewers that hit the spot, nicely spiced.
author: Susan S.

description: Came here with a large group for brunch and had the Turkish breakfast as well as the Omelette and loved the food. The place is cute, unique and the service was great. I will be back!
author: Joshua G.

description: Cozy and clean spot for brunch. I really like the Turkish breakfast and menemen(tomato dish with eggs). Turkish breakfast was for 2 people to share and it had good amount of food and varieties. It had traditional Turkish stuff like sujuk and pastirma, bal kaymak. I will definitely come back and try their dinner menu.
author: Hazal O.

description: As other reviewers have said, the service is excellent here. We really enjoyed the Turkish breakfast for two, and the Arnold Palmer. The interior is lovely, comfy seats and cozy booths. The interior re-design is light and modern. We're looking forward to going to Lokma again soon, this time to try their dinner menu. A welcome addition to the neighborhood!
author: Ellie L.

description: Amazing food and attentive service, great ambiance. Short ribs and manti make a terrific meal to split and the orange tahini cake was really unique! Will most definitely come back, excited to have a quality new spot in the neighborhood.
author: Ashley G.

description: We went there for breakfast. Everything was delicious especially pancakes  They serve refill black tea. Sucuk was also very delicious.
author: Gzde C.

description: We tried Lokma for brunch on Sunday. The menu was not very appealing, so we tried the Turkish breakfast for two - which looks like their signature dish. Well you are basically charged $28 for two cooked eggs, a quarter of a sausage and the rest is raw food (vegetables, fruits, nuts, cheese..). That is very expensive for what you get, especially for this neighborhood. And I was still hungry after the meal. They will have to improve dramatically their menu & cooking if they want to sustain their business. Btw I don't really see what is 'Turkish' about their cuisine.
author: Sebastien G.

description:
I live super close and really wanted to like this place. I came here with 3 friends, and 2 out of the 4 of us liked the breakfast. 
The 2 friends who enjoyed theirs ordered the pancakes and mushroom omelet.
I ordered the breakfast sandy and was actually really bummed. It had mayonnaise caked on both pieces of bread, and inside had a fried egg, lettuce, and tomato which seemed a very odd combo. I wonder if maybe it's Mediterranean stile and that's why the combo seemed strange, but personally I didn't like the taste at all as the egg & mayo combo was too much. 
My husband ordered the avocado toast 3 stiles, and it was really underwhelming. Just bread with some smashed avocado, one with a piece of tomato, one with a piece of pastrami and the 3rd with fennel or something on it. Totally bland and a bummer. I get that avocado toast is simple, but if you offer something like that at a restaurant it should at least be somewhat enticing. 

All in all, I'm going to try a few more things here, but I hope they step up the quality.
author: Hannah W.

description: I had such a lovely breakfast here. I came with with my almost 2 year old and he got the pita with honey and clotted cream. A perfect little treat for him and very reasonably priced. The woman working was super kind and patient, I felt really welcome with my son. They serve Andytown coffee, which was a plus for my friend. Love the presentation, vibes, and delicious food here. Can't wait to come back!
author: Iizzie H.

description: After having a few meals here I can say confidently that this is one of the best restaurants in the Richmond District. It's such a great addition to the area. Some of my favorites include their Turkish Breakfast (great little bites like fresh feta, nuts, bread, etc.) and their pancakes. I recently had my first dinner at Lokma and really enjoyed their burger. It's a beef/lamb burger and was cooked / garnished very nicely.
author: michael l.

description: Just had an Amazing meal at Lokma. My husband and I had the Turkish breakfast I must say it was flavorful,fresh and well presented.  The sujuk and basturma were delicious as well as the carrot hummus, eggs and fresh fruit with a yummy spread in honey to place on your warm pita bread. The pancake was fluffy and garnished with yogurt and fresh blueberries. Turkish coffee made to order. The decor in beautiful relaxed colors give you that outdoor feel even on the foggiest days in the Richmond. Will recommend to my Friends and Family.  This Traditional Turkish food with flair is a welcome change in this area. Can't wait to go back for Dinner.
author: Lana M.

description: Great breakfast menu! Pancakes were delicious and the carrot hummus was one of the best. Did I forget to mentioned endless coffee and tea pours. Lastly, great friendly staff
author: Amanda C.

description: Get the pancakes and the chicken sandwich. Oh, and the Turkish coffee. You can't go wrong. The vibes are very lovely in here. Great neighborhood too -- stop by before walking 20 min to Baker Beach!
author: K T.

description: Wonderful experience with great food! Came here with a group (6 of us), and they were very attentive to our whole group, checking in with us and making sure our glasses stayed full. The meatball appetizer was a great taste, I will have to try the lamb burger next time! Between our group, I was able to try many of the entrees on the menu- the branzino was an easy favorite, and an exciting dish as well! Aside from the excellent service and food, the ambiance fit well with the restaurant; I'm looking forward to coming back to try the brunch!
author: Kayla K.

description: Went here for the first time this morning! Great brunch spot. Wish they had more items on their drink menu, but the food was excellent. Will definitely come back.
author: Justine J.

description: I had the avocado toast and the side salad. Both were delicious. Very cute little corner cafe. I'll be back!
author: Marissa T.

description: Great starters.  Finally a good restaurant in this location! Good service. Really enjoyed the skewers
author: Cary R.

description: Delicious food, lovely setting, easily found parking in front when we had lunch at 1:30 recently. The pancakes were phenomenal, even leftover the next day. The chicken sandwich, best I ever had! Juicy, tender, delicous bread and topping, came with a tasty simple salad. So good my daughter wanted to go back again this week! The menu is limited but since everything is so good, doesn't seem like it would be a problem. I need to try the dinner menu next!
author: Mare B.

description: Very cute brunch spot! It was pretty busy for a place that just opened, but we were able to get seated right away. The food and the service were both great. Can't wait to see what will be on the dinner menu!
author: Vika M.

description: What a nice surprise. Simple menu with delicious, carefully prepared food. The menu doesn't have very many things for vegetarians, but what they do have is tasty and unique. Highly recommended.
author: Keith L.

description: A neighborhood gem.  Care, quality and attention to detail on each dish was excellent.  I strongly recommend the calamari appetizer which was cooked to perfection and well distributed with tomatoes and olives.   I would go back for that dish alone if it wasn't for the dumplings.  Intricately hand made, perfectly presented with a yoghurt, garlic and tomato sauce and delicious.  Add to that genuinely friendly and gracious staff, I will definitely be back.  They don't serve alcohol but don't be discouraged as it will allow you focus on just how damn good their food is.
author: Mark S.

description: Tastes like authentic Mediterranean food, super flavorful and fresh. Cute decor and friendly staff are a plus! 10/10 would come back!
author: Nicole P.

description: The food here was very tasty! The lamb burger was amazing and definitely my favorite thing I tried. We made reservations and our table was ready when we got there and we were seated immediately. Highly recommend for some delicious Mediterranean cuisine.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Great dinner all around.  Food was delicious - we had the Manti, the burger, the stew, hummus, and an eggplant dip and all were super-tasty.  Service was flawless and decor and ambiance perfect.
author: Catherine S.

description: Turkish Breakfast - Menemen - Pancake .... thank you for making me feel the heaven for an hour :) great quality - great service - highly recommended..
author: Ozzy D.

description: Very nice and cozy restaurant for breakfast . Staff is very friendly and food is pretty good. Can't wait to have breakfast there again.
author: Sinem D.

description: Love this new neighborhood restaurant. Dinner was delicious. I had the chicken kebabs which were succulent and well spiced and my husband enjoyed the shortribs. We had started with a an order of carrot  hummus which my husband loved so much he used his finger to get every drop. Looking forward to  the restaurant getting its alcohol license so we could enjoy a glass of wine with dinner.
author: Gail G.

description: I love this new Richmond Dist. eatery!  All of the flavors are fresh and interesting, the service is attentive and down to earth, the environment is comfortable and sweet! Go there!  It will be even better when they have their liquor license and we can enjoy a glass of wine with dinner.
author: Dee R.

description: Really happy to have Lokma in the neighborhood! Great food and great service. The carrot hummus is amazing!
author: Jessica J.

description: Wonderful dinner for four. We each had something different and enjoyed all the food choices. Dessert and coffee...amazing. Service friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend.
author: Jean S.

description: Cafe has friendly servers. Food is fresh and very tasty. We went for brunch. Totally recommended!!!
author: Krutia ..

description: Fantastic service and food, great music, good music. Stoked to have this place in the neighborhood
author: Oliver T.

description: Lokma was outstanding.  I went here with friends for Sunday night dinner and the food was excellent.  The menu was not what I expected for a Turkish restaurant but the food was great.  We had the Carrot Hummus, Honey & Kaymak, Meatballs and Potato app.  All 4 were excellent but the Honey & Kaymak was probably the best.  A couple of us got the Manti and that was amazing.  The flavor is up there with some of the best I have had in Turkey.  My only request would be more sauce and yogurt! I can't wait to go back.  If you like Turkish food definitely a must!!
author: Erol C.

description: Everything was incredibly tasty and well-prepared for the first day. The ingredients were all very high quality and thoughtful and I will definitely be coming back. Great new neighborhood gem!
author: Aaron P.

description: Stumbled upon Lokma driving down Clement Street looking for a fun restaurant. Lovely ambiance, great food, sweet waitstaff - felt very local and homey. And easy. Wonderful spot for Friday night end of week dinner.
author: Brian S.

description: The best ever in restaurant in clement street. The food delicious and the restaurant very clean. The people very professional.and very polite.
author: Rami H.

description: I loved my brunch here. Their pancakes are amazing. My friend also tried their presidio salad which was very good too. Worth to try.
author: Şahin D.

description: This place is delicious! We're sorely lacking in breakfast places in this area so was very excited to see this open. Great food, good ambiance and they had high chairs. Only negative is the coffee was pretty expensive for a small very small pour but it is SF! Overall really recommend and looking forward to trying out their dinner menu.
author: Roz B.

description: I came for breakfast one day and returned the next with family.  The food is great and the service friendly.  The coffee is excellent.  We had the breakfast sandwich which is very flavorful, as are the potatoes, the burger, and the pancakes.  The Turkish sausage was also a hit as was the Ratatouille omelette.  Unfortunately, we leave town today, but our nephew will be back.
author: Barbara S.

description: Nice new restaurant. Inside is tastefully decorated. Staff very nice and welcoming. Very kid friendly. In terms of food: Great lamb meatballs. Their stew and dumplings are good. Would have liked more choices on the menu.
author: Jc B.

description: I've been here four or five times for breakfast. The Greek yogurt pancakes are excellent! The omelette and potatoes are great as well. Nice decor and super nice, efficient service. Definitely worth a visit!
author: Dave E.

description: I loved everything about this restaurant the food is delicious clean and healthy.the servers are so friendly and nice i will comeback for breakfast again for sure .
author: Sami M M.

description: Breakfast-top notch had it on 3 different days will have dinner soon,looking forward to it. Keep up quality.
author: J B.

description: Had a fantastic lunch here this past week and am telling everyone about it who will listen. We had the breakfast sandwich which was one of the best I've ever tasted. The Turkish cheese and honey is phenomenal. The avocado toast was good but not quite as good as the sandwich. The service is friendly and quick. I hope everyone will support this new local spot.
author: Denise G.

description: Great addition to the Richmond!  Came here for Sunday brunch and had a truly enjoyable experience. I typically find omelets to be heavy, but the Turkish omelet was light and favorable. Friendly staff, including husband and wife ownership team.
author: Steve C.

description: Amazing food! Have had brunch and now dinner at Lokma. Excellent addition to the neighborhood!!
author: Ryan V.

description: Brunch was excellent. The dinner menu looks good too; I'll try that later on. Nice addition to the neighborhood!
author: Floyd B.

description: Awesome neighborhood spot for brunch ! We take our son here and he loves the pancakes. We have always had great service. Relaxed ambience with hip decor. Highly recommended
author: J W.

description: This food is fresh and delicious. It is clean and the wait staff is great. Love the Turlu and the eggplant. Great addition to the neighborhood.
author: E P.

description: Great spot. Great food and ambiance. Came for brunch and ordered the burger and husband got the pancakes and eggs. Both fantastic. Good service. Prices are reasonable to standard- not sure what the other reviewers are referencing on cost.
author: Kristina S.

description: I've only been here once so far, but will come back MANY times. The food and service were delightful. Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Tiffany C.

description: This became my fav place to hangout it's an healthy  place specially the pan cakes made of yogurt and honey wow
author: Vinay P.

description: Amazing resturant. The dishes are fantastic and super tasty. The chef put together the most creative and innovative menu which puts a twist on some traditional dishes. Plenty of parking on the street and the ambiance of the resturant is steller. Will visit again soon.
author: Asif R.

description: We ate breakfast at Lokma recently and really enjoyed it. The breakfast sandwich was solid, as was the chicken sandwich. We'd go back and we'd love to see this place last.
author: Brian J.

description: Such a lovely environment with beautiful smiling staff and really tasty food. I recommend to anyone that is looking for a place for a relaxing breakfast with friends or a great spot to read a book.
author: Courtney A.

description: super excited for a totally different kind of spot to open here. after years of high turnover i'm really hoping this place makes it. my friend and i shared a bunch of brunch items and everything was very tasty. we had the greek yogurt pancakes which were really light and had a wonderful flavor, the blackberry bulgar which seemed healthy but tasted too good to be true, the greek yogurt with granola which sounds run of the mill but was anything but, and the house salad (which my friend's 6yo insisted on) and even that was really good. will definitely be back. can't wait to try dinner and the rest of the brunch menu. good luck, lokma!!
author: kimberry l.
